text: My fav Indian food in the city. Period. I love their dinner menu, their buffet, their desserts, and honestly just thinking about it all is making me hungry I've ordered their lunch specials as well and although I prefer the buffet, the food delivered has been consistently fresh and soooooo good.Chicken Tikka Masala: delicious! Creamy and just perfect. I prefer mine extra spicy.Tandoori Chicken: classic, done so well I daydream about itNaan: fluffy and buttery and incredibly goodI hope the mgmt keeps up the quality/service and doesn't take shortcuts like so many other desi spots. The difference shows.I will have to return soon to this part of the city just so I can fangirl some more!

My first time at the Darbar Grill. The food was delicious and the service was first rate. I had been craving Indian food and this place fulfilled my craving in a big way. Our server Simran was fantastic. I would not hesitate to return.

Had the buffet and it was seriously one of the BEST meals I've had in a long time. All the food was flavorful and perfectly spiced.  Excellent selection, 10 or 12 hot dishes. Salad bar, and delicious desserts.  Excellent service. Restaurant was very clean and attractive. Unbelievable deal for $14.95.  Went at 2:00pm on a weekday and there were plenty of seats... surprised it was not more crowded considering the quality of the buffet? Can't wait to go back again!

Darbar was a solid Indian dining experience. Came here on a Sunday lunch but we decided to order a la carte rather than the lunch buffet. It wasn't very busy, only three other parties, with background music playing on the overhead. It's a casual/business friendly setting you could go for an office lunch or take a friend out for Indian food. We were waiting less than five minutes for our food when a waiter came up and tried to rush us for the bill, probably thinking we were eating the lunch buffet, and it was an awkward two minutes when we had to explain what already happened. I ordered the house specialty eggplant bhartha curry while my friend ordered paneer makhani along with garlic naan. The basmati rice is cooked very well especially compared to other Indian restaurants I've been to, and the naan was warm and dotted with garlic bits. My eggplant bhartha came with a slight spicy kick that grew as I ate, which I enjoyed very much but it could've been spicier. I tried the paneer makhani and it was very creamy and a bit more than slightly sweet. In the future, maybe I'd like to try the lunch buffet special for a greater range of offerings. It's a narrow restaurant front, so be careful when entering the lunch buffet area.
Excellent food curtíos quick service. Worth every penny. Lunch buffet had delicious choices.

Went for the AUCE buffet and wasn't disappointed.  The chicken tikka was a little dry, but we went after 3 and it was probably sitting there for awhile (the place was practically empty).  Nonetheless, it was wonderfully flavorful, kind of spicy which is a plus in my book!  Pieces seemed to come from tiny chickens but it was delicious!  The chicken makhani was excellent!  The sauce was tomatoey and buttery tasting, with a slight kick.  The curry goat was tender, and nice sized pieces.  Tilapia in curry sauce was quickly replenished as we couldn't find any fish, and was tasty.  Fresh hot buttered naan was brought to the table.  Saag paneer was good, and was probably even better had we arrived sooner, but no complaints.  There was a peas and potatoes dish which was ok, and vegetable korma which was not bad.  Overall I enjoyed this meal a lot and look forward to eating there again soon.

These are the reviews I most enjoy writing, where I can wholeheartedly say that I had a wonderful experience at Darbar Grill. The food was quite simply excellent, I would argue it was the best garlic naan I have ever tasted. What struck me most, however, was the kindness and genuine service I experienced, thanks to the manager Vishnu. He was kind and enthusiastic to recommend dishes. If you want high quality Indian food coupled with outstanding service, Darbar Grill is the destination of choice.

The buffet is great! I don't think you can find a better price for such verity in this area! The quality is also great. I loved the fish curry and also the first time I ever had fish at an Indian buffet and it was awesome. However I would've liked some more appetizers. A lot of vegetarian options and the choices of desserts were good too.

Darbar offers a pretty solid lunch deal but if you're looking for the best Indian food in town this isn't it.Lunch is a buffet option with a bunch of dishes to choose from. Settle in at your table, grab a plate, and go to town. Everything they serve is pretty standard as far as Indian food goes. Tandoori chicken appeared to be a big hit and I loved that they had curry goat. We loaded up our plates and returned to the quiet second floor (we were a large group). The curry goat was the best part of my dish. I just wish it had some spice (it had none whatsoever). The tandoori chicken was okay but I've had far better elsewhere. The rice did it's job of being a side. The naan that was served to the table was warm and fluffy.Service here is hit or miss. Granted all the waiters do is give you your final bill and your drinks but they barely said a word to us. The buffet works out to $15 for all you can eat which is why this remains a solid lunch deal (especially for Midtown East). I just wish they had more dishes offered in the buffet itself and I know a lot of people can't handle spice  but those of us who can would appreciate more flavor in the dishes.
This place is very delicious and has great Indian food. Visiting NYC from Los Angeles and realized how good the Indian food is here in NYC. Would recommend this place in a heart beat.

This place is a hit or miss. Was here a few weeks ago and the food was great. Went back again and the food was so so. Also the back of the restaurant where we were seated needs some extra lighting. Hard to see what you are eating. Finally be careful- they add on 20% tip for parties of six or more without asking you. I find that offensive. As a matter of fact they are getting more business when more people show up. So what's up with this automatic 20% tip business ? Surely this must be illegal. Tip is something i should give if i want to. Anyway I had to bring it down to 18%. So watch out.
Food was really really good. Service was really good as well. You know the food is good when everything is finished lol.

I decided to walk around and try and new spot as I always do when in NYC. I decided to try Darbar and it seemed promising. But walking in was a different experience. It felt like I wasn't too welcomed. Other than that I had the chicken tima misala, the chicken was over cooked, and the sauce was below average. Maybe the food is fresher during lunch..

This is a hidden gem in Midtown East. Good Indian restaurants may seem like a commodity in NYC, but this one differentiates itself by offering a vast menu of Indian food options. My go to choice is chicken tikka masala and the chef did not disappoint. The entree has rich flavor and spices as one would expect. The rice was included and I opted to get the butter naan along with it. Servers are great and it is certainly a wonderful date night spot. During lunch they offer an extensive lunch buffet and a to go box if you are looking to grab and go. The funny thing is that the server puts things in your to go box instead of you doing it. I personally find that strange, but maybe some dude overpacked his to go box with CTM? In any case great place. If you do decide to eat here the servers expect a tip for the buffet, but throw them a buck or two and just fill up.
Great spot! Can't beat $15 for unlimited delicious Indian food. Perfect for dinner or a mid-day lunch if you're hungry. It's also fairly elegant, and the servers are very attentive.

Came here for their lunchtime buffet. We were all STARVING when we came in for lunch around 2:30pm on a Friday, and the place was pretty empty. The chicken tikka masala was beyond satisfying, and the paneer had a decent amount of cottage cheese blocks. Probably my 2 favorite things there. Overall pretty satisfied, but do think the price of the all you can eat buffet during lunch time is higher than some of the other Indian buffets we went to.Lots of variety to choose from - lots of chicken and if I remember correctly, there was also goat meat. The flavors were on point. Would definitely come back again. Great buffet to go to if you're ever starving around lunch time and want to just stuff your face.
The food delicious spiced to perfection The owner  gracious staff pleasant Drinks good

This review is not even about the food, because what occurred before even ordering made us not dine here. I was there Sunday, Dec 2nd. I did research on the place, liked what I saw here and on their site, but to be extra cautious, I called the establishment to ask if it's cash only (like other restaurants we came across). A gentleman let me know that they aren't cash only. I let him know, "Great, I'll see you soon then!" It's about 9:00-9:15pm. The restaurant closes at 10:30pm. My bf and I arrive and the host comes and tells us we can't eat there since there's only 2 of us. We have to do takeout or delivery. Great, there goes our dinner plans... if this is how the business is run, why is there no warning of this on their site? Why didn't the person who answered the phone let me know this when I said, "I'll see you soon, then!"?Definitely not cool. Especially since there was over an hour left until closing! We were forced to go and take our business elsewhere.

The restaurant was amazing all around! The service was fantastic and the server was very knowledgeable about the different dishes.  The food was probably the best Indian food I have ever eaten in NYC.  The prices were extremely fair and the portions quite large.

Ambiance is not that great, as almost every Indian restaurant is. The samosas are nothing special, the biryani is really good, as well as the chicken tikka masala. Staff is not very prepared, we finished our appetizers and after 10 minutes, they still did not clear our table.

If you are well acquainted with Indian cuisine, you will most definitely appreciate the flavors in the dishes here. I personally tried the paneer makhani and chicken korma, both of which were of gourmet quality. The only complaint I have is that for the price, you're really not going to get much meat so I wouldn't recommend eating here if you're starving or looking for a big meal. But I've also noticed small meat portions to be a trend across Indian restaurants in nyc, hence why I did not let that effect my rating.

Honestly, my cousin and I were looking for a place to sit and talk and eat for a few and stumbled upon this place randomly. There weren't that many people inside so we were skeptical but he wait staff was friendly, food was amazing, we stayed for almost 4 hours just talking. Great atmosphere and they mean spicy if they say spicy. Will definitely go here again!

Ok. So we stumbled past this joint while on the way to a brew pub on the corner. Hostess at pub was rude so we had a drink and circled back to Darbar for something a full 180 degrees from where we started. So glad we did. Although it was 10pm we were warmly greeted! Served a cocktail and given recommendations from both the wait staff and manager. The two of us shared a chicken curry, and the chef's special chicken malai! Ordered spicy with some garlic naan and we ate ourselves to sweet bliss. It's a good thing we had to walk three miles back to our place. We needed it! And so will you!Highly recommend.

Super yummy and friendly service. Several specialty entrees and they'll direct you to other options based on your palate.  I'm stuffed and happy.  The chart offerings are tasty and if toy want heat, just ask!

Lacked in rich Indian depth. The flavor of their curry is just okay, the pictures make the curry look like it would have loads of richness to them but it's pretty basic for how expensive they are! Over priced for their basic flavor. I was expecting the best curry I've ever had. Don't expect this!

If you aren't a vegetarian, please move on as this review is specifically written from the point of view of a vegetarian.  So we visited on a weekend and dived into the brunch offerings.   First off kudos for having more than 3 veggie options as most buffets tend to only offer.   We were able to partake in 6 different options when you include the lentil dishes.   The only issue is the flavor was quite watered down for the average Indian palette.  The hello dal was perhaps most authentic in its flavor profile.  The rest of the veggie options fell flat on either spice ( not heat ).   The naan was amazingly warm, buttery, flaky, and perfect.

We ordered delivery from Darbar Grill.  The food was not super special, but the portions were big and the delivery was speedy.  We ordered the following from the menu:Saag Paneer - Standard and delightful.  It comes with a large side of rice.  Cheese and Garlic Naan - This was very flavorful and was warm and chewy.Chicken Korma - The chicken was a bit dry.  The sauce was light and the cashews were a nice add, but I will not order this again. Vegetable Samosas - These were large sized samosas, filled with potato and peas!  I was quite full after the appetizers!

Delicious food! Had the buffet and just a great selection which included naan and dessert! Got to try new things, all very yummy! Amazing service and very friendly wait staff! Clean and a nice ambiance! Can't say enough good things! Would go again next time I'm in the city!
Food is average.. wait is extra ordinary.. for 1 starter and 1 entree ... 1 hr and still counting..  they seems to push out take out orders faster while people sitting in keep waiting.

If you have an event coming up, small or large, do not think twice before booking Darbaar.  Mike (owner) was so accommodating to a last minute catering request at a venue 150 miles away from New York city.  He not only worked with me on the menu, offered his suggestions but also let me make my choices.  On the day of the event, given that it was an outdoor location, with no facilities or full kitchen, he and his team were incredibly creative and solution oriented.  Once they go to the venue, I did not have to worry about anything.  they handled everything with perfection.  I am a foodie and extremely particular about details, I could not have asked for any better.  Lastly do not cut corner and avoid getting the tandoor and tandooriya - my guests are still talking about the kababs and naan's - it was worth every bit.  Make sure to include this at your event.  my guests claim they have not had such authentic indian food even in india - so that goes to tell you the food is excellent!

My favorite Indian restaurant in the city. I order delivery from here regularly and the food is consistent, great quality, and delicious. The service is always good when I dine at the restaurant as well. I highly recommend Darbar Grill.

Came here for lunch and had the buffet. I waited for 5min at the front and no one greeted me or came to seat me. One of the guests said they just sat down and recommended I do the same so I did. Not the best customer service experience and I had to ask the waiter for water when I was seated. The food was pretty good. The daal was a bit watery (they had yellow and brown lentils) as was the chicken tikka masala, but the other items I tried were great including the mutter paneer, cumin potatoes, chicken keema, and naan. Lots of options and a great deal at $15!

This review is for dine-in dinner.Taste: Below average - (goat entree had too much bone and very little meat)Portions: Very small and left unsatisfiedPrice: Expensive for indian foodService: average and had to ask for water multiple timesDecor: Best part of this place

Wow!!! We had one of the best dinners in a long time. The lamb chops were tender, chicken 65 was spicy and authenticBeetroot malai kofta was very unique, delicious and spicy. Vegetable Biryani had a nice mix of vegetables and flavorful. Chicken vindaloo was hot, moist and flavorful.To close out gulab jamun was hot and delicious.Folks were friendly and attentive. John the exec chef is an amazing person and came out to meet on request.All in all a great experience.

Darbar grill is a great place to eat with family and friends the atmosphere is really nice and I like the food and they have a full-service bar with all kinds of drink specials. The food is terrific, very authentic. Would come back again for dinner or buffet. I enjoyed eating here.

This is by far my favorite indian restaurant in the Manhattan area. We have been coming here since 2014 and absolutely love the food and service. The owner is amazing and so sweet. He was able to accommodate my 5 month old son and his stroller at a larger table on a busy Friday night. Love coming here!
Lunch specials are fantastic here - chicken tikka masala,spinach with paneer, dal, naan and rice are always great!

We were staying at the hotel nearby and chose this restaurant based on the pictures and reviews on Yelp. And we were not disappointed! The staff was really nice and welcoming, the restaurant was beautiful and clean. The waiter was very friendly, explaining the dishes and ready to make any changes requested. One of our requests was to make dairy free Saag (Paneer is ok, just no cream) and the waiter said it's possible. Unlike other restaurants where they say everything is pre-made, no changes possible. Definitely a good sign!The food was delicious! As an appetizer we had delicious vegetable (potatoes and green pea) samosas with tasty roasted bell pepper sauce. We had garlic naan (hot, crunchy, soft and delicious), regular naan (thanks to Yelp check-in), Chana Masala (so good but I wish it had more sauce in it not just chickpeas) and Saag Paneer (without cream). The waiter was so nice, he advised us that it will be more spicy as there won't be cream added, which was totally okay with us. I would prefer if Saag dish was little bit less oily and thinner, however it was delicious. My only complaint would be that my usual "side of cucumbers" (that was initially forgotten about) that usually ranges from $0-$3.00, turned into a $6.00 plate. Even the whole English cucumber is $2.50 or less. So I feel like they overcharged me here. On the bright side, my husband also loved the food here and we will be returning. Can't wait to try more dishes.

Ducked into this place the other day on a business trip to NYC. The food was absolutely fabulous- probably the best Indian restaurant in the city. Very good service- liked the fact that I could order off the menu, even though they had a lunch buffet going. Their lamb boti kabob is soft, succulent and blends a lot of varying spices in; hits the taster at different levels. Their chicken tikka masala and garlic naan was great, as always. Can't wait to try their lunch buffet sometime!

Darbar Grill is serving up Indian cuisine in the heart of Midtown East. the space is not fine dining, but not casual. it's casual classy: perfect for hosting office lunches or dinners, scheduling date night, or introducing newcomers to South Asian foods. the main dining room is on the first floor. the bathrooms are on the second floor where there's and additional dining area. the bar is on the first floor and is fully stocked, not a lot of top shelf...but to be honest when i'm out for indian food...i'm focused on food not cocktails.the menu does a good job of hitting the authentic notes while still leaving room for friendly exploration by newcomers to Indian food. i had dinner, here, recently and enjoyed several dishes thoroughly. the food is not prepared too spicy, so those who fear their mouth being on fire...fret not. the dishes have some kick and if you want more heat/spiciness just talk to your waiter. entrees were/are fairly shareable between two people unless you're super hungry. food-wise i'd recommend:lamb seekh kabah (entree)--spicy minced lamb served skewer style, accompanied with a flavorful sauce. three kebabs. easy to share. tasty and meaty. perfect for carnivores! the tandoori grill menu is done really well here and should be ordered from...eggplant bartha--eggplant cooked in tomatoes and spices. savory. not too spicy. perfect with the basmati rice that comes with each entree.dal makhani--black lentils cooked in tomato sauce, cream, and spices was another winner. and if things get too spicy mid-meal, just order some raita aka cucumber, mint, yogurt sauce...that'll cool your mouth off quick. bypass water that only makes things worse.there's a nice selection of beers here to pair your food of with...and of course they have wine, booze, and mixed drinks too.didn't save room for dessert...next time.service? attentive. friendly. accommodating. tip well. in terms of price for dinner? it's not cheap, but you get great food and service in an modern chill ambience. i will say the bathrooms need to be renovated and updated. they feel old. and sorta smelled bad bc they are old-ish. only reason why i am not 5-starring Darbar.drops mic cuz i'm going BACK TO THE GRILL AGAIN for lamb kebabsi outzzz

Indian food is always hard for me.  I love it, and even though I have eaten a great deal of it, I cant help but always feel like a beginner.  Everytime I dine, it tastes so different...never the same.  Maybe thats what I love about it...or dislike about it.Darbar's lunch buffet was a chance for me to experience more flavors and to be honest most of it did not excite my palate. Fair Warning:  my palate is just that...my palate.I burned through the 'meat dishes' and then moved on to the vegetarian dishes.  One dish struck me.  Phool Maknah. As I ate it, the dish itself was slightly sweet, which I love.  But it was the ingredients that challenged me.  As I ate it, I felt there were small grapes or pearl onions in the dish.  I asked to find out more about the dish, and I learned that it was puffed roasted lotus seeds.  Having never had this, and this was my Aha! moment.   Soft, chewy and full of flavor from the sauce, these lotus seeds are a perfect vehicle for adding texture to a dish.  I love new experiences!They had a mango pudding for dessert which helped me finish the meal nicely.... and then I was full.I may not be back to this restaurant, but I was definitely happy for the experience and the chance to try the new dish!

Its an okay place. We really enjoyed the chicken bhuna mirch but it's suggested if you really enjoy spicy food. We also liked the mango mouse cake but thought the portion size was really small. Rest everything was just okay, we will probably order takeout from this place again.

I ordered paneer to go for lunch. The source is delicious and quite spicy as I like it. I would recommend this place if you want try Indian food. Highly recommend paneer- cheese cubes, if you're not a big fan of Curry.

Terrible experience with Darbar grill! Ordered Goat meat for delivery and it arrived stone cold. I called the restaurant and they nonchalantly responded that it's cold outside so sorry, but we can't do anything about this! I'm shocked that a restaurant with this level of service and this attitude is operating in NYC! If the owner/manager is reading this, I'm not going to willingly get food poisoning (Goat meat goes bad very quickly if it's not maintained at the same temperature) because you're too lazy to deliver food fresh and safely. I'll NEVER order from this place ever again! Plenty of better options available online (Andaz, Moti Mahal Deluxe) and in the neighborhood (Nirvana, Bukhara Grill etc) for good and safe Indian food by people who understand good service...!

Great lunch buffet! A notch above the usual Indian all-you-can-eat fare. I'm a sucker for the goat and literally can't help teasing out the luscious marrow from the bones. Dinnertime is solid, although many of the standouts are already on the super affordable lunch buffet. At night, the environment is pleasant, low lit in the classy wood paneled interior. During daylight hours, gaze up and enjoy the stained glass ceiling!

Well this restaurant should be 2.5 }3stars and not one. But to required more attention from owner, i did rate it one , i will follow more future review, if i feel some change in the food , i will be happy to revisit and rerate it .Rating any business is respobsibility and not fun, and affect people , but taking negative review and try to fix the issue will have positive outcome to the business and owner.Service is great.The decor is great.Location is great.The food is aboslutely suck.I am sorry, i cannot lie .I am hoping that owner/management will take control and change something.In the food business, you can take critics and fix. It.Or you can be stubern and take it with the wrong pride untill you run out of fund and effort.I enter at 12h00 , i was the first one, bad sign but i cannot fully judge.I left 12h30 top rush hour for lunch, nine people or 3 table are occupied.The food was like poorly  seasoned, and has no falvor.From the location, i was expecting very high end indian cuisine, but i was wrongYou have great location that restaurant should be packed by 12h30, but i wonder why empty.Please, the food is blend and no one with knowledge of indian food will go back twiceI dont mind. To spend 25.00 in lunch buffet, but 16.00 in your buffet will be consider 80%waste...When i went out, i feel jealous of people who are taking line cross street for turkish restaurant, because i am sure their lunch will be better than mine and possibility cheaperPlease, dont take it personnal, is all about food.

Ate brunch there last week. It was a ok looking place. The brunch is self serve, and they had a variety of dishes. Chicken tikka, goat curry, fish stew, rice, etc. You can go back for seconds, and the food was plentiful and  a reasonably priced brunch deal.On the down side, except for the chicken tikka, I didn't like the food. The fish stew didn't taste fresh to me. Hours later, I could still taste it, but not in a good way.The place was moderately full at 3pm, so I guess some people like it there. However, I won't be returning any time soon.

have ordered from and been here multiple times because i am fond of the food but recently have had bad experiences both in the restaurant and when ordering delivery. In the restaurant, the hostess was staring at us throughout our entire meal, making it pretty uncomfortable. The waiter also took the food away when we were still finishing off our plates. The last time I ordered online, the delivery was over an hour late. I called multiple times and the manager said it was "5 minutes away" each time.. mind you, i live within a block from the restaurant, should've just picked up. The manager was VERY VERY rude and unapologetic. Will be taking my business elsewhere.

Seated at table with a tablecloth that was already stained-- not a big deal but starts you off with a bad taste.   Went in the winter -  space heaters kept it warm.  Service was a little curt and wasn't exactly gracious.  Food hit the spot though.
Very mediocre food with very average ambience.Very less options in the buffet. Went there on team lunch and was disappointing. Not sure why this place has 4 stars.Please avoid this place.
One of my go to spots for Indian food in the city. Chicken65 was amazing and so was the Beet root kofta (if your vegetarian). The staff is very attentive.

DON'T ORDER ONLINE. I was in one of the Hotel in Manhattan and ordered food through their website,order got accepted but food was not delivered. Someone called me after 60 minutes to tell me they don't deliver to location I was staying at. My Hotel was just 1 mile away. They should not have accepted order if they can not deliver.  Their Supervisor on phone was rude and unprofessional.Horrible customer service on delivery and lied over the phone. Then refused me a refund when food never came.  Avoid at all costs.

Me and my husband were in the city looking for some good food and searched yelp for a good place to eat and unfortunately we didn't like this place . over priced and overly hyped place to say the least. I have had better experiences at dinner in NYC. Taste ,ambience ,service  nothing was extra ordinary and they charge like fine dining . Just an average place . Nothing special. Totally Not worth the money and time

We ordered takeout from here, an order of chicken tikka and saag paneer.  Both were very good and the sizes were very generous. Not just a bunch of sauce with one or two chunks of meat. One portion would have been enough for two people.  Delivery was quick, prices were fair. Would recommend.
Mediocre food at best; stale and lacked flavor. Very disappointing and lacked authenticity.

Went to this place last weekend with my friend for lunch buffet. Its the worst buffet I have ever tasted in new york city. Food wasnt fresh and was just a combination of leftover dishes mixed together. Dessert was even worse. Please save your hard earned money and go to some other restaurant.

We ordered for pick up here. We got the Chicken Korma and Chicken Vindaloo. Both were delicious and a fair portion. We also got the vegetable samosa, shishito peppers, and naan. The samosas were great and a decent size, but the shishitos and naan were both really small for the cost. Will definitely order from here again though!

I don't see what is so great about this place. Service was below average. The quality of the food was average at best. For New York standards, this place is below average. Go to Tamarind  instead. You will not regret it.
Very nice and spicy Indian meal - good chicken tikka masala, with dhal, rice and garlic naan. No complaints. Good service, nice surroundings.
Excellent service and food. The food was delicious especially the Goat biriyani, baigan Bartha and samosa. Free dessert also included.

Very good! All you can eat weekend buffet for $14.95! Has fresh lettuce, tomatoes and beets and 6 vegetarian dishes (3 vegan). Very good and good service. It was a little spicy so if you don't like spice there are few options.
This is a horrible restaurant. We ordered at 7:45... it is 9:45. No food. So, who cares, why order this bad food and wait over two hours. Seriously, so much better Indian food. Management is inept.

We came here for dinner in a group of 14 people.. ambience is good but serving time is too late. We ordered starters at 7pm and got it 7:30 and ordered main course and we after 8:30 which is ridiculous. When we asked the waiter he gave midt a irresponsibile answer saying during these hours it's late. And they were giving lot take out packages to others.
This is, to my knowledge, one of the best Indian restaurants in the city. Their lunch buffet is also a terrific value. The other location on 46th st  is decrepit and unappealing. Avoid it.

I was definitely feeling the vibes at this place, could see it getting lit on a Friday Sat night with adult beverages on tap.  Good mix of swanky and casual - great stomping ground for the older 9-5'ers to let looseI picked up the chicken curry from Darbar Grill via meal pal this afternoon.  The food was ready on time, although I did have to talk to three different people to get my food, (supply chain management issues, smh)Chicken curry was very solid.  I thought that the sauce was mild enough for me but tasted very good as well.  I thought the meal was a little light on the amount of chicken, although I do understand it was good value for meal pal.I would recommend to anyone looking for a solid Indian restaurant for lunch.

Outstanding authentic Indian fine dining cuisine. I regret that I was dining alone so did not have a chance to enjoy all the amazing dish options. However, highly recommend the Chicken Mirch Bhuna with the tandoori veggies. Together is magic!Service was friendly and love the quaint atmosphere of the restaurant. Will definitely come back!

We came here for dinner. We ordered two main entrees and a garlic naan. Food is extremely average. Some of vegetables within the dishes taste completely like old frozen vegetables out of the bag. I was deeply disappointed. The server was nice but the restaurant host was not very friendly. He came and asked me about my reservation TWICE during our dinner and claiming I made two reservations and asked me to cancel one when in fact I only made one and could possibly made one anyways. I confirmed twice that I only made one reservation and showed him on my phone. Then he marked me as "no show" for the dining app. What kind of business does this? I would never come back to this place again.

The food from Darbar is excellent. I put in a pickup order from here the other day and not only was it ready when I arrived, but they made the curry extra mild for me. I tried their garlic naan, which was very good. Baked perfectly! Not burnt at all. $5 for naan was definitely a bit much, but it was worth it.I also had their butter chicken, which was tasty. Like I said, they made it extra mild for me which I appreciated. Even without the spice, it had a ton of flavor. There was also a lot of chicken! So much so that even when I divided it into 2 meals, there was some chicken left over. The only thing I noticed was that the description online said "butter chicken - dark meat" and it was white meat. I certainly didn't mind, just something they may want to change.Also, I noticed a lot of the Indian places in Midtown East are $20+ for an entree. The butter chicken I got was only $15.I would recommend.

When I want something really flavorful and fast, I come here. I haven't tried much on the menu just because every time I go, I end up just getting the Lunch Box #3. They have 3 different options but I get the one with one choice of meat curry, rice, lentils, a vegetable side, and naan. For all that, it's around $10 which I think is really worth it especially in Midtown East. The Lunch Box is fast because they take it directly from the buffet table that they have. They have a lot of other dishes on their menu but if you're looking for a quick meal, it's a good place to check out.
I was charged $20 for an item that's listed here on Yelp as $16. Apparently that's a thing! Makes no sense!!!

Awesome Indian Food and Ambience. Service was also up to the mark and cost is also moderate. You should visit this restaurant if you are in nearby areas and even I would love to visit again.Try Beetroot Malai kofta if you like Sweet Curry.Service: 8/10Food: 8/10Ambience: 7/10
Best chicken korma in midtown Manhattan, amongst a sea of southern Indian food in which it's too buttery and not flavorful. Very spicy and flavorful. Nothing in Curry Hill compares.

Service : 7/10Food : 6/10 ( good isn't spicy which is good for most people but since I'm Indian, it was almost bland for me ) Cleanliness: 10/10 Nice spot for a quick lunch buffet. Wouldn't recommend for a date :D$15 for lunch buffet is a good deal.

This is probably my favorite Indian restaurant. Ive been to quite a few, maybe about 50 Indian restaurants. I've been here a couple of times and they've always been quite courteous. The food is always consistent on quality. They offer delivery which is great and I hope to take advantage of one day! One time I ordered the wrong food (menu change - was confused) which was my fault, but they still went ahead and changed my dish free of charge. Favorite dish: tandoori salmonFavorite Appetizer: bhel puriFavorite drink: mango lassiThe drinks are moderately priced. The buffet is pretty good as well, definitely worth a visit. Give this place a try, you won't regret it! Also recommend it if you're visiting NY and want to have some good Indian food.

Excellent! I was there with my bro and friend visiting on my brothers' proclamations of having the best butter chicken in the City. Not only did they have the best butter chicken but may be the best mango lassi I've had. I'm looking forward to trying their other dishes on subsequent visits.

Love to eat here! Cozy downstairs tables, excellent food. The man is to die for! All the tandoori is delicious every time, vegetables are authentic and yummy. Good selection of wine also.  First time I ever had kulfi was here and no matter where else I try it, it's not as good, so you should try it for dessert.

This was my first time and I am happy to report that I will absolutely be back! The food is excellent- tasty and flavorful. The papads were yummy. And that was the beginning- my cocktail - French martini was amazing. The menu had a lot of variety. And finally the service was excellent!

Ordered butterchicken with garlic naan. The delivery was on time. I havent actually sat down in the restaurant but im writing this, because hopefully the owner would read into their butter chicken recipe. I ordered the butter chicken with some garlic naan. The sauce was great but my gripe was with the chicken in the entree. Other places ive tried seemed to use different parts of chicken but this place seemed to use chicken breast thats dry and without the sauce, not much flavor in the actual meat. The naan was on the thin side, i wish it was thicker or came with more servings for the 5 bucks i paid. Im still giving 3 stars but this was a minor disappointment. Id give it 3.5 stars if i could. Ill still order from here but i cant gice it 5 stars. After ordering another time sometime in the future ill change my review. So until then, this place is still worth going to for the food alone. Not sure about the service as ive not been inside the restaurant.

I ordered the palak paneer and bharta smoked eggplant with rice off of Seamless.  Both seemed a little heavy, despite the fact that Seamless described Darbar Grill as "Healthy" Indian.  The palak paneer was unnecessarily rich, yet lacking in spice or salt.  The bharta flavor was much better, lightly smoky, and a little spicy, but still, it tasted a bit off.  The rice was on the dry side.  All in all, a little disappointing.

This place has lost much of the spice and flavour essential to Indian food. I went here today after around 3-4 months. Bland paneer, dal AND tandoori chicken. Basically, they got everything wrong.If you have any interest in getting any flavour, go to Omar's across the street or even basic ramen. Better than bland food here.
Great food, interesting use of whole spices, good value. I had goat Korea because I was told the goan sauce is very hot. Even the Korma had a little kick so I believe them!
Their lunch buffet is a great deal, authentic and delicious. I love the cozy atmosphere.

Worst Indian buffet I have ever eaten, unfortunately we went by the reviews and got stuck here. Almost empty restaurant on a Sunday afternoon, only people eating were the staff. Food looked stale and very limited food choices. I would never eat here again, very disappointed.

Just ordered from here using UberEATS and I have to say it was a complete home run! I haven't been to the actual location, but the food that was brought to my hotel was fantastic. I ordered the boti kabob, tandoori chicken, and garlic naan - all were great! Sometimes when you order from UberEATS without going to the actual location it's hard to give a fair evaluation, but in this instance I can say I would definitely order again, and I look forward to going to the restaurant. Slam dunk!

By far my favorite place to order Indian takeout from in the city... and there are a lot to choose from. The food is always fresh, hot, and of course delicious. I'm a vegetarian and I ALWAYS get the Paneer Pasanda, but my boyfriend isn't and enjoys their Chef's Special Chicken Malai a lot as well. The only downside is that their dishes are a little pricey, but I usually get about 3 meals out of it for the amount of food that they give you, and the quality is worth it.

Great food with excellent service. I love  the butter chicken and garlic naan bread in particular, but the choices and variations in offerings abound. The owner is everywhere and personally supervises from the bar to the kitchen to the diner's delight. Try it!!

I really enjoy Darbar every time, whether it's in the restaurant or from Seamless.Ambiance: somewhere between casual and fine dining. White tablecloths and a dark interior with gold accents aren't mind blowing, but the space has its charm.Service: friendly, professional, and prompt. Especially noteworthy is how quick their delivery service is.Food: I really enjoy their food every time, and order fairly frequently. Their classics like chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, korma, samosa, and saag paneer are augmented with house specialties like a beetroot dumpling curry and house spiced/herbed lamb/goat (you get to choose the protein). You really can't beat the price point as well.Overall: a great spot to order in from and have a great comfort food night. Would definitely recommend for both dine-in and delivery!

Amazing food and thoughtful staff. Came for happy hour and stayed for the food.  They must have overheard that it was my birthday because they surprised me with a lovely mango cake. I will be coming back here to drink and dine again.
Their lunch buffet is $14.95 plus tax/tip. It's not $12.00 as someone else mentioned.

We took some friends to Darbar Grill for dinner one Saturday night.  We had Chana Saag (Chick peas and spinach), Mutter Paneer, Mango Chicken, Chicken Tika Masala and Goan Fish Curry. Everything was delicious. The servers were attentive and courteous. The place is narrow, but has a nice cozy ambiance. We enjoyed the dinner very much and would highly recommend to anyone wanting to enjoy Indian food.
Horrible customer service on delivery and lied over the phone. Then refused me a refund when food never came.  Avoid at all costs.

The most amazing delicious Indian food.  I'm almost in tears from happiness.  Darbar Grill 55th btwn Lex and 3rd.  The tamarind sauce made me sweat from stressed out happiness.  The plain naan gave me heart palpitations.  The saag gave my body a flush of vitamins from fresh veggies.  DEFINITELY check out the dessert menu!

Like the other Darbar location, Darbar 2, the service at this "original" Darbar is excellent. Really excellent - refilling water, offering ice, cleaning up etc. I've had dinner here which is solid Indian, but today, since Pete and I are extremely malnourished, we decided to have the lunch buffet.First of all, this spot has weekend lunch buffet until 4pm. That is pretty sweet, considering many places only do M-F. $15 gets you appetizers, entrees, sides and dessert. The two kinds of dal were good, as was the veggie Khorma. The chicken tikka mansala was made with a weird iridescent chicken, that I stopped eating once I discovered its sheen... Pete's favorite was the chic peas and Ground chicken. They offered three desserts, pretty generous I thought: carrots pudding, mango soufflé and the obligatory rice pudding. We didn't have the mango soufflé but the other two weren't bad. I could see them refilling the items with fresh food.I would return and get only the vegetarian items. I would surely return for the convenient hours and gracious service.

Excellent lunch buffet. Great selection of all Indian favorites from curries to masala to korma. The atmosphere is classy and composed, and the staff is friendly and eager to refill water, take away used plates, and refill the na'an. The price is great at $15, especially considering it is in Midtown

A great buffet-style Indian restaurant. The dine-in experience here is wonderful, but I often choose the take-out lunch special for both its expediency and its price. I mix it up every time I eat here because it is all tasty, and I sometimes treat myself to the Mango Lassi. 4 out of 5 because sometime I wish the food had a little more kick to it. Not sure if they are appealing to a more bland audience, but none-the-less I love their food and service.

This review is for buffet.  Solid 4 for meats but if veggie dishes are critical for you i wouldn't come here.. Seating area was comfy and nice decor.. good music and good customer service.  I came at 140 on a Friday.. food was quite good.  The tendori had a nice flavor and cooked well.  Masala also good flavor but very mild.  In general everything was too mild for me i like spicy so that is my only complaint.  Curry goat was but i was impressed they even have it in the buffet.  Also a few veggie dishes that were ok.. Ive had better.. last but not least I really liked it how they bring you fresh hot naan instead of having it out cold like some other places. Also Desserts could be better maybe fruit but most places are like this anyway.. overall a good experience.
Absolutely horrific delivery service. Over 20 minutes late without apology. Food is mediocre. Don't waste your appetite, money, or time.

We had the lunch buffet, which is all you can eat.  The food was good and tasty with a good variety, chicken, goat, fish, etc.. The naan is nice and soft.  There is even a dessert bar.  Clean and service is efficient.  Despite it essentially being a buffet, it has a much classier feel.  Definitely worth a visit.

The place is clean and the wait staff is pleasant. However, the food is insipid and uninspiring. The Chicken and the meats tasted bland, while the rice seemed to be a few days old. Overall a very poor experience.
Best Indian food by far. We had the lunch buffet and tried most things, all are delicious.

I was traveling and craving Indian. I found this place and was really impressed. The atmosphere was great with a bar and table seating, music, and great deco. I sat at the bar had a great chat with another traveler who had just finished. I asked what he ordered and he raved about the lamp chops and warned of the portion sizes. I wanted fish and opted for the Fish Curry. It was delicious! The portion size was perfect since I didn't order any apps. That chickpea and cumin bread like stuff that I can never remember the name of came before the meal with some dips and that was perfect over an app. The fish curry was nicely spiced; warm and full of flavor, not too over the top. The rice was nice and fluffy to go with the curry. The owner and staff was attentive, funny, and really made the experience.
Great authentic vindaloo. A breath of fresh air compared to all the new American around this part of town. Comfort food and great waitstaff.

Went out for dinner here a few nights ago, and overall it was a mediocre experience. The food was ok, I ordered a vegetable korma and vegetarian appetizer platter. The korma was bland and underwhelming, and the appetizer platter lacked variety. Additionally, the prices on the menu were standard for the area. However, my favorite thing about this location was the service and wait staff. The restaurant has very nice decor, and the wait staff is very, very attentive and kind. My water glass was always full, and they even served my food in front of me. The table was kept clean, while I was eating, and the waiter reminded me of the free naan bread included in the yelp deal. A++ for wonderful servers.

Great food, nice ambience and very attentive wait staff. The bartender was kind enough to charge my phone while we had our meal. This is defiantly top quality Indian cuisine. I had my usual chicken tikka masala, that's my go to Indian entree but I really love it all. I didn't want to fill up and be stuffed since we had a lot more city exploring to do so I just kept it at that. I do recommend!

Had the buffet lunch at Darbar last Sunday...overall it was a bit underwhelming.Service wasn't very friendly but the servers moved the used buffet plates rapidly so I can't really complain.Ambiance is nice enough, nothing to write home about. The restaurant was fairly busy on a Sunday afternoon.Food is where Darbar falters. While there are lots of options on the buffet, especially for meat eaters, the quality isn't nearly as good as nearby Chola. Price is very reasonable at $15 or so per person.Overall we do prefer Chola and will likely go there instead when we need our naan fix.

Brought my British boyfriend and he approved! I've never tried salmon tikka masala, but it was excellent. Their mango chutney is definitely large enough for 3-4 people and we were spoiled. The owner was genuine and caring. Definitely check it out while you are in town!

Lunch buffet  it was ok, nothing outstanding. Tandoori chicken average, chicken tikka masala was slightly below average, goat was pretty good, naan was good. All else was so-so. Service was meh. Tables crowded with local middle management types lunching between meetings. Reminded me a a TGIF Friday's, only Indian.

Always high on my list of places to eat whenever I visit NYC. As a Brit, I feel I know a thing or two about good Indian Food and this place ticks all the boxes for me. Great tastes, correctly spiced and a wide range of choices. Often order variations on dishes they have and they always accommodate my request.

Enjoyed the food here and decided to set up a special celebratory dinner here for a friday evening.  To be certain that there weren't any mix ups with an open table reservation, I went in on Monday afternoon and placed the reservation in person showing exactly where I wanted to be seated.  Was assured that all would be perfect come Friday night.  On Friday evening, I came in with my group and not only had the manager forgotten about the reservation he personally had taken but he had given the round table away.  Sorry, your food isn't that good to put up with such incompetence.

We landed here because of a good Yelp rating, and we were not disappointed. It did however take a long time for the server to visit our table. Overall the service was decent, it just lacked the usual pleasantries we're accustomed to from good waiters. The server just walked up to our table and looked at us until we ordered, no introduction, no greeting, no "Can I get you some drinks?". However, the food was outstanding! We had vegetable samosas and Garlic and Cheese Naan for appetizers, and Chicken Tikka Masala for dinner. I would definitely recommend this place to others. Perhaps the wait staff will have attended charm school by then.

I have eaten Indian cuisine all over the world.  Last night my family and I enjoyed one of rare perfect dining experiences.  From start to finish, food, service, and drinks were exceptional.  We are definitely coming back.
Had boxed lunch with tandoori chicken, chicken tikka curry , butter naan and rice . Food was tasty. Would like to go again

As a desi person I usually don't go to Indian places but I loved being here. I'm always a sucker for chicken makhni and this place didn't disappoint. It was properly spicy (just fyi - I follow Indian spice ratings, not American), and the gravy was divine. The chicken was nice and tender, too - not overcooked and I'm pretty sure it could stand alone without the gravy.
Reasonably good lunch buffet with good dessert options.
Food was awesome and the service given by waiters were not good one of the employ was screaming on other employ service was not good we don't like it

Overall pretty mediocre and not a great value for the price. Ordered the samosa, chicken tikka, and lamb biryani. The chicken tikka was the best dish we ordered, and everything else was meh. Also didn't love the setup of the restaurant - ugly fluorescent lighting at the front tables and way too dim at the back. On the bright side, the waiters were accommodating when we asked to move tables because a drunk man was speaking very loudly at the bar and we couldn't hear ourselves think. Free naan deal through Yelp was also sweet.

Went on a Monday night and it was quiet and perfect for a work dinner.   Staff were very friendly.   We had the gobi Manchurian cauliflower which tasted delicious, and almost nothing like Cauliflower.   It had a sweet and tangy coating on the outside.Then for the main meal I had garlic naan and their madras chicken curry.  The curry was good, but a little spicier than I expected. The flavor was also not quite as rich as I'm used to elsewhere. I might try something different next time, although there was absolutely nothing wrong with that dish.  The naan was soft and delicious.  I would definitely come back next time I'm in town.
Good Indian food. I like the lunch buffet they providePeople are nice. Location is clean.I don't really like the statue outside and we need to go down the stairs to enter.

The food was just okay. It was a buffet with lots of choices to pick from. The food was cold though. The candles underneath were not lit. The naan was way too crispy on the backside and it just fell apart. The basmati rice was perfectly cooked and the goat curry was well seasoned. Otherwise, everything else was just meh. We will not be back.

My favorite Indian buffet. Great price and the food is consistently delicious -- I've been here several times now and am always satisfied. And by satisfied I mean so full I can't exactly walk but it's worth it because the food is really good. The staff is always friendly which is a big plus as well, and they're knowledgable about allergies (or, at least, have been good about telling me what has gluten - have never gotten sick).

I walked several blocks to check out this restaurant based in yelp reviews. It was 12:30pm in a Thursday afternoon, and the place was around half full. I was seated immediately. Before i even sat down, the waiter suggested that I eat from their buffet. I had to insist that I wanted to see the menu. The food was average, pretty standard indian lunch buffet. I wouldn't come back, unless I had no other choice. The price was good..

This used to be one of my favorite places for lunch or after work happy hour and dinner, but I wonder if they have recently changed management or hired a new chef. After several months away, I was excited to grab some saag paneer here today. Not only did it taste completely different than it used to, but less than half way through my meal, I suddenly felt sick to my stomach though I had felt fine before and hardly ever have stomach issues. I hope this is a one time thing, but when the food makes me sick that quickly (and didn't really taste great to begin with), it makes me very hesitant to go back.

Brought a party of about 15 here to celebrate an engagement. The food was absolutely amazing, especially the Butter chicken and the lamb kebab. The service was also exceptional. I would highly recommend this place.

Highly recommend. Always leave happy after eating here. Amazing Indian food- food is always served hot and fresh, the flavors are amazing, you'll be happy with whatever you get off the menu. The butter chicken is the best

AMAZING food whether you like indian or not. just to die for! My absolute favorite place to eat. Amazing quality and relatively cheap.surprisingly, the majority of the people that eat here aren't Indian, so don't be scared if you aren't! Just tell the waiters straight up and they will guide you to the type of food you would like, whether you like spicy/curry, or not. I personally can't handle that stuff, and they gave me very mild but delicious items.Really good for bringing a group of friends or for date night! ;)
Good Indian food for a reasonable price.  The tandori chicken was tender and perfect, while the curry goat could have been stewed for a bit longer.  Overall a great meal.
Really fantastic food - impeccable service. Totally top notch. Generous wine pours, too.
AMAZING FOOD AND SERVICE. Perfect sit down dinner! They even gave complimentary dessert of gulag jamuns for each for a member of the table. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
Everything was delicious. Highly recommend the eggplant bharta. Service was excellent!!

Darbar recently catered my wedding and they were amazing throughout the entire process. Besides the food being terrific, Mike helped us with wedding planning far beyond what was included in the(incredibly affordable) price and helped us make sure our 100+ guests had a great time. Mike treated us with the same attention that I would expect from a much more expensive affair. The entire wedding was fairly DIY with a very raw space; it would have been hard to pull it off without Mike's attentive help and willingness to answer questions. We emailed him constantly with questions that went way beyond his service, and he always knew what we should do. On the day of, he noticed any problems before they happened and took care of it so we could enjoy ourselves. Service was perfect, the food was enjoyed even by the Indian food naysayers (this was a non-Indian wedding), and everything went off without a hitch. We got so many compliments on the food! Before the wedding, we both visited this location two times and had a great meal both times. Mike and his team also came to the space, way out in Brooklyn, to see how they would set everything up. I still periodically have dreams in which I am eating the beatroot malai kofta--I awake with drool on my pillow.To anyone wanting catering or just a meal, this is your place!
We found this place on Yelp and have been going back ever since. Service and food never fail!!!!  Love it here.
Generally very good food, great masala. 3 stars for serving whole wheat pita bread for "naan".

Fantastic Indian food interpretation. My girlfriend and I stopped in after a night out and about. She ordered the lamb biryani and I, the chana masala. The masala was excellent, not too sweet or creamy. We also ordered rosemary naan which had excellent flavor. You can tell that the food comes from a smaller, in tuned kitchen with its complex tastes. I even ordered a chana saag and more naan to go. The service staff is also very attentive. I would order a beer or basic cocktail if you're looking for alcohol. Specialty cocktails are not their forte. However I know I'll be back for more Indian fare very soon!
Food was amazing and The Service was exceptional.  They serve you constantly and The place is nice.

Great ambiance, good service and good food.  Took my wife because she's been wanting to go to an Indian restaurant for a while now and I came across this restaurant on FB.  It was #1 to go to #spoiledNYC website.  And they were right.  We'd def go back &a with a bigger crowd.  Chicken tikka masala was great.  Def try the okra dish.  I forgot what it was called but an excellent appetizer.  Drinks were ok.  I had the Mango Pineapple drink.  The wife had the 5 spice.  Mine was eh. Hers kicked in after dinner . It could have def been stronger.  Enjoy!!
The buffet food exceeds expectations.  The place is immaculate and the staff is attentive.   The lunch buffet is a bargain. The Curry fish rules!

I was craving Indian food and decided to get lunch here today. The place looks nice, and the staff is helpful and courteous.The food, however, is a bit bland. The chicken tikka masala has way too much tomato paste.The paneer lacked salt, and didn't have any taste.The naan was good.Other than that, I won't return here. I have to get my Indian food fix elsewhere.

We went to this place after reading 4 star reviews on yelp but it was such a disappointment. We had lunch buffet. Except couple of dishes nothing was good. Food had too much color added to it. Tandoori chicken was covered in red color and tasted  like previous day's leftover food. This would probably be one of the worst Indian food we would have had in long long time. Though the location is fantastic but we will definitely not go back.
Excellent food and service. I came here with my three children. This was our first time as we are from out of town but I would come here again.

Guys I could not stop myself while eating food here. It's one horrible food that I have not had in the longest time. Do not even think of coming here. Vegetarians it's a Do Not Enter sign for u. So watch it!

I've had Indian food before and this place was nothing special. The service was amazing, everyone was taking care of use making sure everything was explained and food came out in a timely manner. Unfortunately I didn't like the food. My go to food is usually chicken samosa and lamb vindaloo yet here I did not enjoy it. The samosa was very large and the inside was too dry for my taste. The chutney that I put on it didn't really add any flavor to the samosa.The vindaloo was spicy and flavorful but it worried me that it tasted like I was in an Italian restaurant eating spicy lamb meatballs instead of a traditional Indian dish.

I have been here for lunch buffet way more times than I can count. I've brought friends here who are visiting and craving Indian food, because it's delicious and has a pretty good variety of choices. The tandoori chicken is so tender and delicious, and the chicken tikka flavor is spot-on (it's more reddish than orangeish). They also usually have goat curry, fish curry, lentils, and a super yummy chickpea-ground meat thingy. My only gripe is I wish the saag/spinach thingy was the kind with the paneer/cheese cubes (it has corn in it instead), but I just get some cheese from the other dishes so it's ok. They serve fresh naan and also have a little dessert bar with flan, mango mousse and watermelon. The restaurant is clean and the environment is really nice for talking/catching up, which is also why I love this place. I will continue to spend money and gain calories here because it's definitely worth it.
My first time trying Indian food and it was delicious. Loved the vegetable platter, onion naan, Chana Saag, and Shrimp Cochin Curry! Definitely would come back!

Hi Mike & Jesi,  We had a great time at your Restaurant.  We booked a banquet hall for my daughter's graduation. Everything was we'll organized, food & service was excellent. Thank you for taking care of us.  Joy Zinto from Los Angeles.

We have been on the HUNT for Indian food and we came across Darbar actually based on Yelp. It was Fantastic. There were tons of options and the food was pretty tasty if a little on the spicy side. I got chicken korma and my boyfriend got the garlic shrimp. The shrimp dish was hot hot hot. Next time we know to order mild. I loved the pillowy texture of the naan. Service was super attentive. Peter was very knowledgeable on the menu and made us comfortable. I know we will be back. **update. We ordered delivery from Darbar on a Monday night. Usually I am suspicious of delivery after getting burned by cold food, inaccurate deliver times, and crap portions (I'm looking at you Chinese place that shall not be named). Darbar exceeded expectations-- the food was hot, the portions were huge, and delivery was timely. This could turn out to be a regular deliver place. The hunt for Indian might be over as this place delivers. Both in person and actual delivery. . Also the man I gave the order to over the phone was exceedingly nice. Keep up the good work!
I am really impressed by their service and quality of food. Great ambience, soft music in background and authentic Indian food. I highly recommend vegetable biryani and grilled vegetables.

I'm so glad I ordered lunch from this place today. I was so nervous because of some reviews. The huge portions really surprised me. They had a 9.95$ lunch box deal that I ordered along with samosas. The lunch box came with four pieces of good sized tandoori chicken. There was rice with Dahl and saag. A naan bread was wrapped up with the order as well. I was full before I knew it with so much food to spare. The samosas were seasoned well and the sauces were delicious. The tandoori chicken was moist and the saag was so good. If I ever need a huge lunch I know where I'm ordering from.

Ate dinner here while traveling - its a shame since i could only sample one dish. The Korma was a thick and flavorful sauce. A little heat, just enough to emphasize spices without drowning the taste. Garlic naan had chunks of strong garlic and the bread was fluffy and chewy, not tough or crispy. Good job. I would eat here again. Staff was friendly and polite in a formal way.
Generic food and bad quality! Also, highly unprofessional in terms of delivery timeline.

We were a group of 15 ppl and they setup the table on the 2nd floor which quite annoying knowing the fact that its buffet and you need to walk at least 2-3 time to fill in your plate. We were split in 2 separate grps even after asking to join the tables. And mind you the AC was not working upstairs. And now for food there was huge queue already waiting in for the their turn that too at the very narrow entrance. Dosa was good though. Too much of red color added in tandoori chicken and chicken Tikka masala. Samosa were like frozen ones. Main course has also degraded over the years. Over all not a good experience if you want to go for office gathering. Disappointing experience. Better try Bhatti in 28th and Lex.

I love curry and Indian foods are my thing! Finally got a chance to try this lunch buffet with a friend and it was wonderful! From starter, the seats are comfortable and the space between others are not too close. And I love that the skylight at noon project the rainbow on the table, very delightful! The waiters are attentive and refilled our water couple times.

Do you enjoy eating an unlimited amount of food? Check. Do you enjoy slightly spicy food? Check.Do you enjoy rice and meats? Check.Do you like reasonably priced food? Check.Darbar Grill has the most amazing lunch buffet ever. Its about $13.95 if I am not mistaken, and the food is excellent. There is even white table cloth on the table, which makes you feel more "high class".There is a chef who makes you dhosas from scratch at the lunch buffet. He feels it with potatoes. Its absolutely delicious- you must order one! They also have plain rice which you can top with tandoori chicken, chicken tikka masala, fish curry, dhal and saag (the gooey spinach mixture).Everything was so good! They even had desert, which I did not eat as I was too full. I can't wait to come back for a cheap and delicious lunch!

i had buffet lunch here recently. The ambience is good as well as the food. I am a vegetarian and hence can comment only on vegetarian items. Apart from regular curries, the most of loved was kadi pakoda. Its been a while since i tasted a very good kadi pakoda curry which was fresh and hot. The bread and rice were also fresh and hot. I would certainly go here next time!!

we were four friends went for a dinner tonight. quite place, ambience was good. we ordekka for app r  panner tikka tandori mix grill and garlic chese naa. for main couse, we had chicken bhuna, madrasi chick, lamb rogon josh,  garlic naan, keema naan, lemon rice. all the foods were delisious. we really enjoyed our dinner experience here. special thanx to our server Anuj. he was very helpful, attentive and guest oriented.  we will be back.

I've tried so many Indian restaurants, and I've got to say, this is one of the best places I've been to! The cauliflower manchurri was so tasty, and if you're big tikka masala fan, this place is for you!  On top of that, the service is top notch!!!
Have always had a good experience while dining in at the Darbar. But ordered for a delivery this time. Instead of the Garlic shrimp balichao, received Gobi (cauliflower) manchurian!!

We asked for mild spice but they gave us very spicy food my children couldn't eat. Then they offered to give beryani with mild spice. At the end discovered they added the beryani to the bill. If it wasn't for that I would've given them 5 stars

We went here for the 4th time and it has always been outstanding. However this time, for the first time, a couple of the meals we ordered seemed "paste based" rather than true curry with meat cooked in a sauce. So much so that I would not order them again if I went back.My great memories were spoiled by this.

Excellent food, nice atmosphere. This is not your generic Indian restaurant. The dishes had unique flavors, different from each other and noticeably different from the same dishes in other Indian restaurants. It was a little hard to communicate with the staff. It seemed they had trouble understanding us and we had trouble understanding them. In general, there was an air of bewilderment to the dinner that cost Darbar Grill a star. Still, excellent restaurant and well worth a visit!

Awesome and timeless consistency in their food preparation and taste!  Last time I was here besides today, it was over a year and they haven't skipped a beat!  Very well priced and a jewel in the rough!  Buffet is fresh and delish!!!  Go there!  You won't be disappointed by the warm welcome, service and price points!  Hey, you may even meet Gabriel H. at the bar who cares very much about the patronage!

Stopped there today after chola had a private party and was closed.  Saturday lunch buffet was decent - 3 stars.  Naan was excellent but the rest was standard quality.  The review gets bumped an extra star because my picky 8 year old only ate white rice and the owner did not charge at all for his meal!
Solid menu, very tasty, large portions, extremely reasonably priced. Great option for delivery in a neighborhood filled with lots of Indian restaurants.
Staff is very nice! Place is fairly fancy on the inside. All you can eat lunch buffet is a must! Chicken tikka masala wasn't the best I've had but everything else was great.

My coworker and I ordered takeout from here and it was amazing! We got chicken tikka masala, garlic naan and samosas. Everything was flavorful and the food arrived to us hot. I didn't expect the garlic naan to be so soft and warm considering that the food was delivered, but it was perfect nonetheless. Portions were great as well, we had leftovers to enjoy the next day. I would definitely recommend ordering takeout from here. It hits the spot when you're craving Indian food. I would also go to the restaurant and check it out in person.
Its run to the mill. Nothing Spectacular. I had food delivered.

I had a very bad experience . We ordered, paneer makhni , bhindi masala and lemon rice. Paneer makhani was too much salty . When I told waiter, he told me that he won't charge for this dish, later on the bill he gave me did not take off the paneer item. He said his system could not take this off. I think this place doesn't deserve the ratings it has on Yelp. Not worth going.

Went here a few times for lunch buffet while working in NYC. Food was solidly good as was the service. It gets busy and a bit loud during lunch. They have lots of vegetarian and vegan options. The naan is perfectly cooked. I wish the mint sauce had a bit more heat and I wish a few of the buffet items had some heat too. Most things seem to be cooked mild.
Good food, cheap prices. Ambience was good and we didn't feel rushed. We will visit again.

Some of the best Indian food in NYC. Nice atmosphere, friendly service expansive menu and reasonable prices. Will definitely come back and would be my first recommendation to others seeking a good Indian meal. I recommend the Rosemary naan and lamb curry.

My husband and I have eaten here many times and have never been disappointed. We often bring out of town guests. Have been to Indian 5X so can attest that the cuisine is authentic and flavorful. Good sized portions, delicious naans. Buffet is best Indian in the City, wide variety with good vegetarian selections also. Clean, well spaced tables, set with linen cloths and napkins. Classy and cozy, dark wood and a lovely skylight. Attentive friendly service, never rushed. Middle aged crowd, so quiet and well mannered. Conveniently located near E train @ 53/Lex.

They have a great lunch buffet in terms of diversity of items as well as the taste. I came during the huge Blizzard of 2016, and they were still open and remarkably full. The lunch buffet goes until 4pm! So that's perfect for those night owls who can't get up before noon on the weekends...In any case, the decor itself is nice. I guess the one annoying thing that happened was that when we arrived at 2:50pm during the blizzard, there was one other party there. We were told to sit anywhere we want. We chose a 4-person table at one corner with good lighting. Someone ran over and told us that we couldn't sit there. We asked why, and they said they had a reservation. We asked when. They said 2:50pm. I was going to get angry right there. It was obviously a lie. Who makes a reservation during a blizzard for an Indian buffet at 2:50pm??? In any case, we didn't escalate it and sat at a dark 4-person table. We later brought it up to the manager, and he apologized and said it should never have happened. The buffet itself was delicious. They had your standard chicken tikka masala as well as lamb and fish options. In addition, they had a vegetarian section with saag paneer (tasted different than others I've had...) and some kind of breaded veggie. In any case, all good. They also had a dessert bar with mango pudding and rice pudding. Very good. Overall, the price was also reasonable, at under $15.

Been here twice for the lunch buffet.  For $15.20 (incl. tax) its a great deal.  I always leave overly full and happy.  They serve you your own bread, which is great.  Buffets are always mildly spiced so I ask for chili peppers and/or hot sauce.

Went for the lunch buffet towards the end of service. The spread was good, a good variety of food. We went basically 45mins before end of the buffet, so some dishes weren't hot, but they did replenish the most popular items even that late. Service was friendly. The restaurant was a bit too dark towards the back, especially for a lunch buffet session. The food was tasty and there was naan for the table. Overall, good food and great value. I would definitely come back for the lunch buffet (though not at the end).

I don't know much about Indian food nor am I the master of all spices, but out of the many times I've visited Darbar, I've never been disappointed.Darbar has a very affordable and accessible lunch buffet for the midtown lunch crowd. It also has very speedy deliveries via seamless. By dinner, Darbar transforms itself to a mcfancypants restaurant. The inside resembles a fine steakhouse: elegant and classy. I'm talking about white table clothes and folded napkins, white gloves on waiters and exposed bricks on walls (haha, if you care). For the price you will pay for the atmosphere and food, it probably has the best value for its location. Indian food isn't that cool with the younger non-indian crowd so you can avoid the annoying hip crowd of izakaya and speak-easy kids. That's a plus in my book.The food is fantastic. I'm a Southern Chinese kid who likes things mild, and there are more than enough options here thats easy on the stomach and tongue, like the salmon curry and the usual chicken tikka masala. The butter chicken serves as a nice American spin if you need to maintain your overweight BMI like me. The choices for naan is plenty. I've only tried the cheese and garlic naan and the regular garlic naan and they're both good. What really hits it home for me is the delicious biryani rice that comes with the curry. I was happy to eat the rice with just the curry sauce with no proteins at all.The service is nice, even though its funny how they switch from formal mcfancypants to super casual gestures sometimes. Sure its not the service you would receive from michelin restaurants but the heart is definitely there. For Indian food lovers, I recommend Darbar (and I'm looking for fellow Indian food lovers in midtown :( )
Awesome place , outstanding Indian in New York City . Please try here chicken  mirch Bhuna .

High quality and tasty.  Their garlic naan was excellent.  Chicken tikka marsala also very good.  They have a cold salad plate that tasted like a health salad I would get at the second avenue deli.  We went for a catered party and the service was on point.  The restaurant has two levels and we used the entire upstairs which was spacious enough for 40 people.

I always ordered out via the Seamless app, and got the Chicken Tikka Masala; today I ate on site in the restaurant and it was a pleasant experience with extremely courteous staff. The Chicken Tikka Masala is by far hands down, the best in the island of Manhattan- amazing! I will continue to eat from Darbar. Keep up the brilliant work!
Most excellent food and drink. The Tamarind margarita is fantastic Lots of vegetarian choices.  Arrive early or have a reservation

I've never in my life written a review before--that's how bad my experience here was. The good:- I guess the utensils were clean? Now that I think about it, they weren't. I'll get back to you. The bad:- Forgot to put the mango in our mango lassi...acted as though we were a burden when we mentioned this to the waiter- Put about 9,000mg of salt in our biryani. When we pointed this out, our waiter said to "put some raaita on it" (which of course was another $4)- We really, really gave it a good faith effort, but upon concluding that the dishes were inedible due to salt overload, we notified the manager and he brought out "new" dishes after about 30 min and 47 dramatic eye rolls - Meanwhile, overheard at the table next to us: "are you guys killing the cow back there? It's been an hour"- At the end of all of this, of course we were still charged for the botched mango lassis and biryani--and you know what, that's fine, we ate some (like, 1/15th) of them, whatever. BUT THEN THESE GUYS TOOK THE LIBERTY OF TIPPING THEMSELVES!!!! Are you forreal? Is this real life??!  Is there a way to do a negative tip??? I just had an aneurysm. Please, for the love of God, don't eat here. If you've read this far, you care about the quality of your food and the quality of your service. You deserve better. These guys do not deserve to be a restaurant in New York City. Just say no.

This place was amazing!! I'm from Kansas City and came here 2 weeks before we won the World Series and the clientele was the nicest to us out of every place we went. It was also my birthday and they brought me out the best dessert I've ever had; it was like a mango creme brûlée! We got the stuffed pita with lamb and some sort of cauliflower for an appetizer and then the chicken in tomato sauce with rice! (I explained that food in English terms) and even if you're not into ethnic food, they will have something on menu I know anyone will like!!

Don't get take out. 90 yes 90 minutes after we order on seamless and get email that order is on the way, nothing. We have to call, they  apologize., no food. There are at least 20 Indian restaurants in this hood. Never ever again.

Since I have been there more than 20 times, I have to review this place. The food is good , hot ( most of the times). The place os well decorated and clean .Staff is very knowledgeable and on top of their service, hot amazing bread all the time.I have managed to get plenty of my coworkers their and they loved it. - Good for a business meal or romance as well.

This is likely my favorite restaurant in New York City.Everything from the service to even the condiments served on the side is delicious and very good quality, something that is rare in this city.If I had to choose my favorites here (something that's exceedingly difficult), I would have to choose the poori, the chana masala, and definitely the chicken malai, which is the best I've tried anywhere.This is one place that you should definitely visit if you're taking a trip to the city! I've been here twice already in a week.

Orders through Eat24. Delivery was more than 30 minutes late to arrive. One of the dishes - Grilled Vegies, was so small I felt ashamed for them.
